intro: Dontospermum graveolens, commonly known as the stinking fig, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round, yellowish fig that is often used in traditional medicine. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the plant exudes a strong, unpleasant odor.
